div1.p: Kean discusses efforts to control yellow fever, and notes the extent to which it has spread in the corps.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Mrs. Mason Young, October 20, 1900
div1.opener:
CHIEF SURGEON'S OFFICE.
HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT WESTERN CUBA.
QUEMADOS, CUBA.
Sat. morning
Oct. 20 1900
MORRIS
My dearest Gran
div1.p:
I have only time
for a line before the
mail goes, and I want
to send one as I failed
to get off a letter Wed.
as I was under impres-
sion that it was Tuesday.
I suppose that Louise
and the children will
sail the day after to-
morrow on the Crook.
I hope dear Gran that
you do not feel too
badly about their com-
ing to Cuba when Havana
is in so bad a fix. I
feel sure that at Colum-
bia Bks we can with
our present knowledge
& experience keep the
yellow plague at bay
until the cooler weather
drives it away.

You have of course seen
in the papers the sad &
tragic death of the Petersons
He was the youngest Major
in Cuba only 34, and
she a very handsome wo-
man. I hear tho. that
she had a cancer & had
been told by her physician
that she could not expect
to live more than a year
longer. So she determined
to avoid that year of
sorrow and pain and go
with him and who can
blame her. They had no children The sight of
her coffin in a hearse follow-
ing his in the caisson was
a very affecting one. The
funeral was not a mil-
itary one but our staff
attended mounted &
with side arms. The Div. Hdqrs
is now thoroughly aroused
and will today take
some steps to move with
their clerks to safer
places. Major Ladd
has had twelve clerks
taken out of his office with
it & still has not moved-
but here there has not
been a case in four weeks,
and none in two months
which cannot be traced
to Havana.

I will begin soon to
rustle around and pre-
pare for my little family.
I have already engaged
Rufina as cook. The
quarters there will not
I fear be entirely finished
but we are pushing the
quartermaster all we can.
Mickie Slocum & I get up
now every morning at
630 and take a ride
CHIEF SURGEON'S OFFICE.
HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT WESTERN CUBA.
QUEMADOS, CUBA.
MORRIS
before breakfast, and we
always come around
by our little barrack &
the Generals cottage at
Columbia Bks to see
new the repairs are
progressing.

I hope Emma turned up
to go with Louise.

Love to all dear Gran
from your son
